info.headline: Flood Warning issued January 24 at 9:55AM CST until January 25 at 10:16PM CST by NWS Houston - Galveston
info.description: ...The National Weather Service in Houston/Galveston TX has issued a Flood Warning for the following rivers in Texas... Colorado River at Columbus affecting Wharton and Colorado Counties. For the Colorado River...including Columbus, Wharton, Bay City, Matagorda...Minor flooding is forecast. ...FLOOD WARNING IN EFFECT FROM THIS AFTERNOON TO LATE TOMORROW EVENING... * WHAT...Minor flooding is forecast. * WHERE...Colorado River at Columbus. * WHEN...From this afternoon to late tomorrow evening. * IMPACTS...At 34.0 feet, At levels above 34 feet minor lowland flooding begins as the flood plain in the vicinity of the gage is inundated. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 9:15 AM CST Wednesday the stage was 29.3 feet. - Bankfull stage is 34.0 feet. - Forecast...The river is expected to rise above flood stage late this afternoon to a crest of 35.7 feet just after midnight tonight. It will then fall below flood stage late tomorrow morning. - Flood stage is 34.0 feet. - Flood History...This crest compares to a previous crest of 36.1 feet on 02/23/2003. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood && Fld Observed Forecasts (10 am CST) Location Stg Stg Day/Time Thu Fri Sat Colorado River Columbus 34.0 29.3 Wed 9 am CST 34.1 24.3 17.2 &&
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Motorists should not attempt to drive around barricades or drive cars through flooded areas. Additional information is available at www.weather.gov. The next statement will be issued late tonight at 400 AM CST.
